summary: This is an email chain from August 2019 between attorney Teri Gibbs and an Assistant United States Attorney regarding scheduling interviews for two clients who allege they were assaulted by Jeffrey Epstein in June 2004. The emails discuss arranging in-person and video conference meetings and include references to providing photographs of the clients from 2004 for identification purposes.

persons.name: Teri Gibbs
persons.context: Attorney corresponding with the U.S. Attorney's office to schedule interviews for her clients who are alleged victims of Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Lisa Bloom
persons.context: Listed as a recipient on the email chain regarding victim reports against Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Arick Fudali
persons.context: Identified as a New York attorney who will accompany a client to a meeting with the U.S. Attorney's office.

persons.name: Colleen Mullen
persons.context: Primary recipient of the initial email regarding victim reports; appears to be an Assistant United States Attorney.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the criminal case (19 Cr. 490 (RMB)); alleged to have assaulted the attorney's clients in 2004.

connections.description: Attorney Gibbs is communicating with AUSA Mullen to schedule victim interviews for the Epstein case.
Fudali is identified as Gibbs's New York attorney colleague who will accompany a client to a meeting.
Gibbs is representing clients who are alleged victims of Epstein.
Mullen, as an AUSA, is involved in the prosecution of Epstein (case 19 Cr. 490).

events.title: Alleged assaults by Epstein

events.title: Scheduled victim interview
events.description: A proposed in-person interview date for one alleged victim with the U.S. Attorney's office.

events.title: Initial attorney call
events.description: Attorney Teri Gibbs spoke with the U.S. Attorney's office regarding her clients' allegations against Epstein.

keyFacts: Attorney Teri Gibbs represents two clients who allege they were assaulted by Jeffrey Epstein in or around June 2004.
The correspondence is part of case 19 Cr. 490 (RMB) against Jeffrey Epstein in the Southern District of New York.
The attorneys provided photographs of the clients from 2004 and asked prosecutors to check if they appear in photos seized from Epstein's home.
Meetings were being scheduled for August 26-27, 2019, including an in-person interview and a video conference to accommodate different time zones.
The email chain highlights the ongoing investigation and victim coordination following Epstein's 2019 arrest.
